DocumentUri.description: A tagging type for string properties that are actually document URIs.

FormattingOptions.description:
Value-object describing what options formatting should use.
The FormattingOptions namespace provides helper functions to work with
[FormattingOptions](#FormattingOptions) literals.

insertFinalNewline.description: Insert a newline character at the end of the file if one does not exist.

tabSize.description: Size of a tab in spaces.

trimFinalNewlines.description: Trim all newlines after the final newline at the end of the file.

trimTrailingWhitespace.description: Trim trailing whitespaces on a line.

Position.description:
Position in a text document expressed as zero-based line and character offset.
The offsets are based on a UTF-16 string representation. So a string of the form
`a𐐀b` the character offset of the character `a` is 0, the character offset of `𐐀`
is 1 and the character offset of b is 3 since `𐐀` is represented using two code
units in UTF-16.

Positions are line end character agnostic. So you can not specify a position that
denotes `\r|\n` or `\n|` where `|` represents the character offset.
The Position namespace provides helper functions to work with
[Position](#Position) literals.

character.description:
Character offset on a line in a document (zero-based). Assuming that the line is
represented as a string, the `character` value represents the gap between the
`character` and `character + 1`.

If the character value is greater than the line length it defaults back to the
line length.

TextDocumentIdentifier.description:
A literal to identify a text document in the client.
The TextDocumentIdentifier namespace provides helper functions to work with
[TextDocumentIdentifier](#TextDocumentIdentifier) literals.

uinteger.description: Defines an unsigned integer in the range of 0 to 2^31 - 1.

ch.description: The character that has been typed.

position.description: The position at which this request was send.
